text:
Hello
i am trying to fetch private application  *scopes information* via API but i am not find any relevent solution :slightly_smiling_face:

do you have any idea ? please suggest me

Thanks in Advance :thanku:
Is there really no way to get the associations for a *single* custom object entry?

Hello, hope you are well :slightly_smiling_face:
Having some issues retrieving all the associations between contacts & companies via the API, example attached, did it happen to any of you ? Any ideas where it could come from ?

Does the list endpoint not work for this? */crm/v4/objects/{objectType}/{objectId}/associations/{toObjectType}*
Given a object id, and then the object type to find associations for.

Hello everyone.

I'm trying to get contact info by contact id and these: `["company, notes_last_updated, firstname, lastname, createdate, lifecyclestage"]` are the properties I need but for some reason, I'm not getting all of them. When I change the order of the properties string, sometimes `company` or `notes_last_updated` appear in the response, and sometimes they don´t.

This is the request:
`api_client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id(contact_id=contact_id, properties=["company, notes_last_updated, firstname, lastname, createdate, lifecyclestage"], archived=False)`

I did some tests using the API endpoints, and I did some tests using my own requests and is the same result in both of them. Properties must be in order or something like that? Or if any of these values are null, does it affect the request?
maybe you want quotes around each property? `"company", "notes_last_updated"`

Hi everyone, do anyone have documentation (or a link to it) regarding the _widget_ schema (what a GET to the API return when asking for a page, in JSON format). What I'm trying to find is which are the _type_ of widgets that exist (i.e.: "text", "choice", "textarea", "raw_html", etc.), and maybe a commentary about each type. I'm trying to identify all the widgets that could contain text.
Lol yeah, that solved my problem. Thanks so much <@U034X9K26MD>

Hey everyone, I'm having an issue involving the Source Code API and module.html files.  For some reason, I'm getting HTTP 409 errors whenever I try to upload module.html files, and this occurs on fresh test accounts.  The weird thing is that this process worked back in May, and the code involved hasn't really changed since May, either.  These files in question are valid with no errors, so I don't know what could be happening.  Did the July 29 update affect this particular API?  What could be the issue?
Is there a way to set up property sidebars with the api instead of going to <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/customize-record-sidebars|settings > objects > record customizations>?
hii! I am looking to push a github repo to the HubSpot Source Code API. Is this possible or do I have to have the files locally in order to specify the correct content path?
When I run the sample string though the process I get a space charchter before the ID, try trimming the `dealId`
you mean there is a white space before the id?
<@UFBNA9K9A>?
Yeah exactly

If I want to use a *webhook* to send data from an external application to my HubSpot CMS account, what *webhook url* would I use in the external app? For example, if I wanted to create a new contact in HubSpot upon the detection of a property change in the external application, would I use the url “<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?hapikey=[INSERTAPIKEY]>”?
that url will create contacts but you need to make sure that the body of the request contains all the required parameters
Are there any examples of a node.js webhook  that has a bearer authorization from custom code action? We need HubSpot to do a PUT webhook, but its default is only PUSH and GET

Update:

Yesterday I renamed the production Private App in question, and, as expected, doing so had no operational impact.

Thanks!
Might as well remove the limit and after as well :slightly_smiling_face:

Think what you need is on this page 
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>
"view private app access token information"
Can you display your request call?
woop that did it. thanks. Sucks I have to inner join another API call to get properties but this works.
Thank you <@UD53A9UUR>
